Package edu.uiowa.cs.warp

Class Warp

java.lang.Object
edu.uiowa.cs.warp.Warp
public class Warp
extends java.lang.Object

This is the entry point to the warp program.

Version:
1.5
Author:
sgoddard

  • Field Details

    • NUM_CHANNELS

      private static final java.lang.Integer NUM_CHANNELS
      The default number (integer) of wireless channels that are available to schedule. This is a command line option.

    • MIN_LQ

      private static final java.lang.Double MIN_LQ
      The minimum link quality in the system. This is a double from 0 to 1 that represents the minimum percentage that a link can fail to send. This is a command line option.

    • E2E

      private static final java.lang.Double E2E
      The default end to end reliability for all flows This float represents the percentage of successful data transfers through the system that is required. This is a command line option.

    • DEFAULT_OUTPUT_SUB_DIRECTORY

      private static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_OUTPUT_SUB_DIRECTORY
      The default sub-directory for the output files produced by the program
      See Also:
      Constant Field Values

    • DEFAULT_SCHEDULER

      private static final SystemAttributes.ScheduleChoices DEFAULT_SCHEDULER
      Determines what scheduling algorithm is used for the scheduling of messages. ScheduleChoices is an enum which is a part of the SystemAttributes Interface which extends the ReliabilityParameters Interface.

    • DEFAULT_FAULTS_TOLERATED

      private static final java.lang.Integer DEFAULT_FAULTS_TOLERATED

    • nChannels

      private static java.lang.Integer nChannels
      The number of wireless channels that can be used to schedule messages. Each channel can process a set of instructions per time step.

    • numFaults

      private static java.lang.Integer numFaults
      The number of faults that will be tolerated per edge. An edge connects two nodes.

    • minLQ

      private static java.lang.Double minLQ
      A global variable for the minimum link quality in the system. Later you can add a local minLQ for individual links.

    • e2e

      private static java.lang.Double e2e
      Minimum link quality across the entire system.

    • outputSubDirectory

      private static java.lang.String outputSubDirectory
      Path to the subdirectory where output files we be located. Out put files are gv, wf, ra.

    • guiRequested

      private static java.lang.Boolean guiRequested
      Flag for if a gui is requested.

    • gvRequested

      private static java.lang.Boolean gvRequested
      Flag for if a graph visualization is requested.

    • wfRequested

      private static java.lang.Boolean wfRequested
      Flag for if a warp file is requested.

    • raRequested

      private static java.lang.Boolean raRequested
      Flag for if a reliability analysis file is requested.

    • laRequested

      private static java.lang.Boolean laRequested
      Flag for if a latency analysis file is requested.

    • caRequested

      private static java.lang.Boolean caRequested
      Flag for if a channel analysis file is requested.

    • simRequested

      private static java.lang.Boolean simRequested
      Flag for if a simulation file is requested.

    • allRequested

      private static java.lang.Boolean allRequested
      Flag for if all out files are requested.

    • latencyRequested

      private static java.lang.Boolean latencyRequested
      Flag for if a latency report is requested.

    • schedulerRequested

      private static java.lang.Boolean schedulerRequested
      Flag for if a scheduler is requested.

    • verboseMode

      private static java.lang.Boolean verboseMode
      Flag for verbose mode. Mainly used when running in an IDE.

    • inputFile

      private static java.lang.String inputFile
      The file where the graph workload is read.

    • schedulerSelected

      private static SystemAttributes.ScheduleChoices schedulerSelected
      The schedule that is requested.

  • Constructor Details

    • Warp

      public Warp()

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)

      Entry point of the warp program.

      Sets up the warp parameters according to the command line arguments. The program will print the parameters if it is in verbose mode. Then a workload is created based off of the input file. Finally if all was requested, all visualizations files are made, and if set

      Parameters:
      args - command line arguments.

    • visualize

      private static void visualize​(WorkLoad workLoad, Visualization.WorkLoadChoices choice)

      Visualizes a workload.

      Puts the visualization in the the output folder directory. The type of visualization is determined by the choice object that is passed in.

      Parameters:
      workLoad - The workload to visualize
      choice - An item from the WorkLoadChoices enum that specifies what visualization to create.

    • visualize

      private static void visualize​(WarpInterface warp, Visualization.SystemChoices choice)

      Creates a visualization for a WarpInterface

      Puts the visualization in the the output folder directory. The type of visualization is determined by the choice object that is passed in.

      Parameters:
      warp - a WarpInteface probably a WarpSystem class
      choice - An item from the SystemChoices enum that specifies what visualization to create.

    • verifyPerformanceRequirements

      private static void verifyPerformanceRequirements​(WarpInterface warp)

      Verifies a WarpInterface's performance.

      Verifies the deadlines, reliabilities and if there are channel conflicts. If something is not verified a message will be printed to the console and in the case of a failure to verify the deadlines or the channel conflicts, a deadline/channel report will be created. If everything is successful a success message will be printed to the console.

      Parameters:
      warp - The WarpInterface to verify.

    • verifyReliabilities

      private static void verifyReliabilities​(WarpInterface warp)

      Checks if the reliabilities are met on the WarpInterface.

      NOTE: the reliability check is currently not implemented and will always return true. Prints the result of the check to the console.

      Parameters:
      warp - The WarpInterface to check the reliabilities of.

    • verifyDeadlines

      private static void verifyDeadlines​(WarpInterface warp)

      Checks to see if the deadlines are met on the warp interface

      Returns false if there is at least one deadline missed. If a deadline is missed a deadline report file will be created. Result is printed to the console.

      Parameters:
      warp - The WarpInterface to check the deadlines of.

    • verifyNoChannelConflicts

      private static void verifyNoChannelConflicts​(WarpInterface warp)

      Checks if there is a channel conflict in the warp interface.

      The result is printed to the console. If a channel analysis file was not originally requested, one will be made.

      Parameters:
      warp - The WarpInterface to check the channel conflicts of.

    • setWarpParameters

      private static void setWarpParameters​(java.lang.String[] args)

      Sets the class attributes based on the command line arguments.

      If no value is given for an attribute the value will be set to the default.

      Options

      • -sch, --schedule %s {priority,rm,dm,rtHart,poset} #scheduler options
      • -c, --channels %d {[1,16]} #number of wireless channels
      • -m %f {[0.5,1.0]} #minimum link quality in the system
      • -e, --e2e %f {[0.5,1.0]} #global end-to-end communcation reliability for all flows
      • -f, --faults %d {[1,10]} #number of faults per edge in a flow (per period)
      • -gui %v #create a gui visualizations
      • -gv %v #create a graph visualization (.gv) file for GraphViz
      • -wf %v #create a WARP (.wf) file that shows the maximum number of transmissions on each segment of the flow needed to meet the end-to-end reliability
      • -ra %v #create a reliability analysis file (tab delimited .csv) for the warp program
      • -la %v #create a latency analysis file (tab delimited .csv) for the warp program
      • -ca %v #create a channel analysis file (tab delimited .csv) for the warp program
      • -s %v #create a simulator input file (.txt) for the warp program
      • -a, --all %v #create all output files (activates -gv, -wf, -ra, -s)
      • -l, --latency %v #generates end-to-end latency report file (.txt)
      • -i, --input %s # of graph flows (workload)
      • -o, --output %s # where output files will be placed
      • -v, --verbose %v #Echo input file name and parsed contents. Then for each flow instance: show maximum E2E latency and min/max communication cost for that instance of the flow
      Parameters:
      args - An array of strings of the command line arguments

    • printWarpParameters

      private static void printWarpParameters()

      Prints the warp system configuration parameters
